page.title: 11THE OLD RAILWAY
page.content: The land in this area varied a great deal.All the fields in the area are used for crops,but there were no animals in the fields because the fields were for Arable farming.One field looked like grass,but turned out to be sweet-peas. Another area was derelict,it was where an old railway used to be,the track that used to connect Lincoln and Grantham.It is very rocky and in some place very muddy.This square contains an old tower in a dereiict brick yard, 2 gas holders near the common land,known as the south common, (which is also in this square)which has a golf course,and an area where ponies can graze.Near here is Coningsby Crescent-a residential area, and a hotel named Eardley's hotel. { The Viking Way}passes through this area.
